You’re a moron.

Yeah if your not going to help please get off the forums… log in to iamadisorder.com or something and go away we dont need scrubs like you.
[/quote]

No you’re a moron. Hyperion is a basic start, you need to add player rights, you can’t just do that…[/quote]

… What part i gave him the checklogs did you want me to give him the

import java.io.File;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;

code as well?

item.title: Hyperion - How to I change Player Rights? PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

You need to add them.

Hmm looking around but looks like Scape-JAVA
is correct
there is no admin.

Simple add a
public int playerRights = 0;

Or set up a AdminFile
Alot of people dont suggest i suggest just so Hackers dont some how change there Rights because i’ve had issues in the past with this

	public boolean isAdmin() {

		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}
	public boolean isMod() {
		if (checkLog("mods", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

ofcourse your going to need this

	public boolean checkLog(String file, String playerName) {
		// check bans/mutes/chatlogs etc.. -bakatool
		try {
			BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config//"
					+ file + ".txt"));
			String data = null;
			while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
				if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) {
					return true;
				}
			}
		} catch (IOException e) {
			System.out.println("Critical error while checking for data!");
			System.out.println(file + ":" + playerName);
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		return false;
	}

Although you will have to modify the code to hyperion…
